Confined Space – Level 2 Medium Risk, City & Guilds
Valid BOSIET, MIST and Offshore Medical, Vantage No: 1103572
CAREER SUMMARY
July 2019 to Date / May 2008 to July 2018 Alfa Laval UK
Position: Sr. Field Service Engineer
Alfa Laval is a world leader in Separation and Heat Transfer solutions, servicing a wide range of industries. He is responsible for the maintenance, commissioning, fault diagnosis and optimisation of Alfa Laval’s product range at sites all over the UK & Ireland as well as on board various ships and offshore platforms. This requires liaising with customers to provide a world-class cost-effective service. His main duties include:
Service and maintenance of Decanters, High Speed Separator type centrifuges and other Alfa Laval products.
Cleaning, overhaul, pressure testing and upgrades to various GHPE.
Carry out surveys of customer equipment making recommendation of maintenance or upgrades they may require.
Commissioning and optimising new and old installed systems to customers required standards.
Extensive inspections, mainly in the water utilities industry. Detailed reports are then produced on equipment condition to allow the customer to make informed decisions. This then allows the minimum amount of equipment downtime in this vital industry.
Maintenance and upgrades to PLC control systems, requiring the use of PLC programming software.
Required to work flexible hours, often working away from home and at weekends at short notice.
Working most of the time unsupervised taking initiative and responsibility for his decisions.
Written reports to be produced and supplied to the customer of any work carried out.
July 2008 to July 2019 Moody Direct
Position: Separator Service Engineer
Moody Direct is a focused supplier of process, packaging and services to the dairy, beverage, brewery, food, ice-cream, pharmaceutical, industrial, chemical and personal care industries. Offering a sole source for the widest range of products they supply a service that can draw on some of the best-known brands in the industry providing both genuine and alternative parts. His main duties included:
Service, maintenance and commissioning of HSS type centrifuges. Brands include Alfa Laval, GEA Westfalia, Mitsubishi/Samgong and SPX Flow Seital.
Support the rest of the service team with the maintenance of pumps, valves, homogenisers (high pressure pumps), heat transfer, pasteurisation equipment and various other products as needed by the business.
He also undertook a role of developing new business for the company drawing on previous relationships. This has led to the successful tender and awarding of several service contracts.
Improved reporting methods that fit with the modern expectation of today’s customers. Developed a new report template that would be used to allow the service team to quickly provide the customer with relevant information via an iPad
Sept 2001 to May 2008 Royal Air Force
Position: Propulsion Technician
11(F), 25(F) Squadrons & AMF (Aircraft Maintenance Flight), RTP (Reduce to Produce), RAF Leeming, North Yorkshire
He was part of the squadron’s ground crew responsible for the day-to-day maintenance on the Panavia Tornado F3 aircraft. His main duties included:
Reactive and preventative maintenance of the complex Rolls Royce RB199 gas turbine aero engine and associated aircraft systems. These included, the hydraulically controlled flight controls, fuel system and environmental controls. Afterwards providing detailed reports of the work carried out.
Effective fault finding of this system by interpreting information from aircrew and other trade debriefs.
Work to computerised and printed maintenance procedures to enable the minimum amount of aircraft down time.
Use of specialist test equipment to dia

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
